description: This is an Android Kotlin source file defining a RecyclerView Adapter for displaying keyboard keys in a user interface. It manages creating view holders, binding data, handling focus, click, and key events, and setting accessibility descriptions for custom keyboard keys.

classes.name: KeyboardAdapter
classes.description: Adapter class for recycling keyboard key views in a RecyclerView, handling key interactions and accessibility.

classes.name: KeyboardAdapter.KeyVH
classes.description: ViewHolder class managing individual key item views, binding data, handling focus, click, and accessibility setup.

methods.name: onCreateViewHolder
methods.description: Creates and returns a new KeyVH (ViewHolder) instance inflating the item layout.

methods.name: onBindViewHolder
methods.description: Binds data to the ViewHolder, sets focus change, key press, and click listeners for each key item.

methods.name: getItemCount
methods.description: Returns the total number of keys.

methods.name: bind
methods.description: Binds a KeyboardKey object to the ViewHolder, setting text, accessibility, and focus behavior.

methods.name: applyFocused
methods.description: Updates the key view's UI based on whether it is focused, changing overlay appearance.
